typography.import_instructions: Add this to index.html or import in CSS: @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@400;500;600;700&family=Plus+Jakarta+Sans:wght@400;500;600;700;800&display=swap');

usage_rules.headings: Use Plus Jakarta Sans for all h1-h6. Tracking tight (-0.02em). Weight 600 or 700.
usage_rules.body: Use Inter for all paragraphs, inputs, and table data. Tracking normal.
usage_rules.data: Use tabular-nums class for all numeric data in tables (grades, SKS, tuition).

Card.usage: Use for Dashboard stats, Course summaries. Always use with 'shadow-card' class.

Table.usage: Primary component for Master Data, Grades, KRS. Use 'w-full caption-bottom text-sm'. Header must be 'bg-slate-50'.

Button.usage: Primary actions: 'default' variant (Indigo). Secondary: 'outline' or 'ghost'. Destructive: 'destructive'.

Dialog.usage: Use for all Create/Edit forms (Add Student, Edit Grade). Do not use separate pages for simple CRUD.

Badge.usage: Status indicators. Green=Active/Lulus, Yellow=Cuti/Probation, Red=Drop/Tidak Lulus, Blue=Enrolled.

Sonner.usage: Use for all success/error notifications. 'toast.success("Data saved")'.

Avatar.usage: User profile pictures in header and tables.

layouts.sidebar: w-64 flex-shrink-0 bg-[#1e1b4b] text-white hidden md:flex flex-col

motion.page_transition: initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 10 }} animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }} exit={{ opacity: 0, y: -10 }} transition={{ duration: 0.3 }}

accessibility.contrast: Ensure all text on colored badges is readable. Use 'text-white' on dark badges, 'text-slate-900' on light badges.
accessibility.focus: All interactive elements must have 'focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-blue-500' styles.
accessibility.aria: Tables must have captions. Icons must have aria-label if no text accompanies them.

login_background.description: Modern university building with stairs, inspiring ascent. Use for Login Page background with overlay.

student_hero.description: Students studying in library. Use for Student Portal Dashboard Hero.

lecturer_hero.description: Professor teaching. Use for Lecturer Portal Dashboard.

logo_placeholder.description: Placeholder for university logo if none provided.

3d_libraries.charts: Recharts (via Shadcn Charts) - Do not use 3D for data. Keep it flat and clean.
3d_libraries.hero_elements: None required for this professional dashboard. Focus on clean typography and spacing.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. THEME: Implement a 'Professional Academic' theme. Clean, white backgrounds, deep blue navigation.
2. LAYOUT: Use a fixed sidebar layout for the dashboard. The sidebar should be dark (#1e1b4b).
3. TABLES: This is a data-heavy app. Tables must be impeccable. Use 'compact' spacing for rows but generous padding for the container.
4. FORMS: Use Shadcn Form + React Hook Form + Zod. Validate everything.
5. LANGUAGE: All UI text must be in Indonesian (Bahasa Indonesia). e.g., 'Dashboard', 'Mahasiswa', 'Mata Kuliah', 'Nilai'.
6. ROLE-BASED: Ensure the UI adapts to the role (Admin sees everything, Student sees only their data).
7. EMPTY STATES: Always provide a helpful empty state for tables (e.g., 'Belum ada data mahasiswa. Tambahkan sekarang.').
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for headers/modals only.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
